Package uo.ri.cws.application.service.invoice

Interface InvoicingService

All Known Implementing Classes:
InvoicingServiceImpl
public interface InvoicingService
This service is intended to be used by the Cashier It follows the ISP principle (@see SOLID principles from RC Martin)

  • Method Details

    • createInvoiceFor

      InvoicingService.InvoiceDto createInvoiceFor​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> workOrderIds) throws BusinessException
      Creates an invoice for the work orders indicated by its id. All the work orders must exist and be in FINISHED status.
      Parameters:
      workOrderIds - , the ids of the work orders to be included
      Returns:
      the dto of the newly generated invoice
      Throws:
      BusinessException - if - Any of the indicated work orders are not in FINISHED status - There not exist any of the ids indicated

    • findWorkOrdersByClientDni

      java.util.List<InvoicingService.InvoicingWorkOrderDto> findWorkOrdersByClientDni​(java.lang.String dni) throws BusinessException
      Returns a list with info of all the work orders of all the client's vehicles
      Parameters:
      dni - of the client
      Returns:
      a list of InvoicingWorkOrderDto or empty list if there is none
      Throws:
      BusinessException - DOES NOT

    • findWorkOrdersByPlateNumber

      java.util.List<InvoicingService.InvoicingWorkOrderDto> findWorkOrdersByPlateNumber​(java.lang.String plate) throws BusinessException
      Returns a list with info of all the work orders of a vehicle
      Parameters:
      plate - , the plate number of the vehicle
      Returns:
      a list of InvoicingWorkOrderDto or empty list if there is none
      Throws:
      BusinessException - DOES NOT

    • findInvoiceByNumber

      java.util.Optional<InvoicingService.InvoiceDto> findInvoiceByNumber​(java.lang.Long number) throws BusinessException
      Parameters:
      number - , of the invoice
      Returns:
      the InvoiceDto with the data of the invoice
      Throws:
      BusinessException - DOES NOT

    • findPayMeansByClientDni

      java.util.List<InvoicingService.PaymentMeanDto> findPayMeansByClientDni​(java.lang.String dni) throws BusinessException
      Parameters:
      dni - of the client
      Returns:
      the list of the PaymentMeanDto of a client represented by the dni or an empty list if none
      Throws:
      BusinessException - DOES NOT

    • settleInvoice

      void settleInvoice​(java.lang.String invoiceId, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Double> charges) throws BusinessException
      Creates the charges against the indicated payment means (with the amount indicated) and then pass the invoice to the PAID status.
      Parameters:
      invoiceId - , the id of the invoice to be paid
      charges - , a Map whose: - Key (String) represents the payment mean id, and - Value (Double) represents the amount to be charged to the payment mean
      Throws:
      BusinessException - if - there is no invoice for the invoiceId provided - the indicated invoice is already in PAID status - does not exist any of the payment means indicated by the id - the addition of all amounts charged to each payment mean does not equals the amount of the invoice with a precision of two cents ( Math.abs( total - amount) <= 0.01 ) - any of the payment means cannot be used to pay the specified amount: - For a CreditCard, if the current date is after the validThough date - For a Voucher, if it has not enough available for the amount - For Cash there is no constraint, cash can be used always Note: the domain model does not have the proper design to do it polymorphically, THUS add a public abstract boolean canPay( amount ); method to PaymentMean class and the proper specialization on the child classes
